text:
Hey! So the notes I do have on the reel might be things you plan to change anyways, but here's some stuff I noticed... 

Be consistent with the text. On the second shot, robot in car, the text jumps/changes of Escape Studios. 

Also using the logo for your school 
Like this (attached) might look more professional. 
Reference reels that professional studios create. 

I would lose the "personal project text" and just leave it blank. 

Also don't really need  the "responsible for." 
For example 
"Modeled characters, textured props" Instead of responsible for modeling penguins & texturing kitchen props 

The text might also look nicer at slightly lower opacity to highlight your work more

When you do the wipes it may look better with a line down the middle to distinguish the layers better. And I think the penguin breakdown should show off your textures rather then the compositing. 

Dont need the solid title that just says "breakdown."  Also the music is kind of unnecessary. Don't need to give anyone a reason not to watch your reel and to want to watch it multiple times. 

For the model breakdowns I would try to either wipe the layer on in one frame or wipe them on as it is rotating so it lines up. When the next layer comes on and the rotation changes it is distracting. 

Cool work! Are you still finishing school?
